page.title: 04Port Lympne Wild Life Park
page.content: Port Lympne Wild Life Park consists of two hundred and seventy acres, which includes fifteen acres of garden. It is owned by Mr John Aspinall, the millionaire who seeks to protect and breed from rare and endangered species of exotic animals in this area of outstanding natural beauty. The animals are housed in huge paddocks, and visitors leave their cars and walk round this well-wooded park to see the animals. There are breathtaking views across Romney Marsh to the English Channel, and on a clear day, the coast of France.
